projects.title: SpellBound Survival
projects.blurb: A 3D survival game, built for mobile using Unity and C#. Players gather resources, craft, and battle enemies in a dynamic world.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: SpellBound Survival is a 3D magic-themed survival game developed in Unity3D using C#, built primarily for Android with touch controls and adaptive resolution. Players explore a procedurally arranged world, gather materials, craft equipment, and battle enemies using intuitive on-screen spellcasting.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Scene & State Management: Seamless transitions between menus, zones, and gameplay scenes with persistent player data.
Zone & Difficulty Design: Procedurally populated biomes with multiple difficulty levels and visual indicators on the world map.
Loot & Combat System: Unique enemy stats, behaviors, and loot tables. Real-time combat and spellcasting using a shared mana pool.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Custom Building & Storage System: Modular base-building with snapping placement and persistent save data.
Dynamic Interaction Framework: Unified input for gathering, combat, and object interaction via contextual on-screen buttons.
Editor Customization: Designer-friendly item, enemy, and loot-table editors for rapid iteration.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Touch-optimized mobile controls
Adaptive resolution & multi-platform support
Procedural zone generation
Persistent inventory and progression
Custom base building
Real-time combat and spellcasting

projects.title: Fortune Slots
projects.blurb: A polished collection of themed slot-machine games for mobile, featuring custom payouts, bonus rounds, and daily rewards.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Fortune Slots is a mobile slot-machine collection built in Unity3D using C#. Designed for Android and iOS, it features touch-optimized controls, adaptive resolution, and a polished arcade presentation. Players can explore a range of themed slot machines, each with its own mechanics, layouts, and bonus systems.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Dynamic Scene Management: Smooth transitions between menus, game scenes, and bonus modes with persistent player data.
Game Selection Hub: Scrollable selection interface to browse, unlock, and launch different slot machines.
Wheel of Fortune: A daily reward mechanic allowing free or premium spins for extra currency bonuses.
Bonus Mechanics: Randomly triggered bonus rounds providing mini-games or special spin events for extra rewards.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Customizable Slot Templates: Each machine’s reel layout, symbols, and paylines are fully configurable within the Unity editor.
Dynamic Payout Tables: Adjustable bet modifiers and win conditions per machine type.
Cross-Platform Ready: Engineered for mobile devices but compatible with Windows builds without modification.
Touch and Resolution Adaptation: Scales intuitively across multiple screen sizes and aspect ratios.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Multiple themed slot machines
Daily Wheel of Fortune rewards
Bonus rounds and mini-games
Custom paylines and bet systems
Touch-optimized UI
Multi-resolution support
Persistent player progress
Cross-platform compatibility

projects.title: Shape Wars
projects.blurb: A fast-paced 2D arcade shooter for Android featuring enemy waves, boss encounters, and adaptive difficulty scaling.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Shape Wars is a 2D side-scrolling shooter developed in Unity3D using C#. Designed primarily for Android with touch-optimized controls and adaptive resolution, the game challenges players to survive increasingly difficult waves of enemies while striving for the highest score.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Dynamic Level Progression: Level types are defined through scripts that control enemy spawn rates, difficulty scaling, and boss encounters.
High Score Persistence: Player performance is saved between sessions using Unity’s built-in save and load systems.
Boss Battle Integration: Dedicated encounter types disable standard spawning and introduce unique enemy patterns.
UI and Controls: Custom-built Unity UI for intuitive on-screen movement, abilities, and menu navigation.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Scripted Enemy AI: Each enemy type features an individual movement and attack behavior script with scalable difficulty.
Adaptive Resolution System: Ensures consistent presentation across various Android devices and aspect ratios.
Modular Level Design: Levels and enemy configurations are data-driven, allowing easy expansion of new waves and bosses.
Cross-Platform Ready: Fully compatible with desktop builds without code modification.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Fast-paced 2D shooter gameplay
Progressive enemy waves and bosses
Persistent high score tracking
Touch-based mobile controls
Dynamic difficulty scaling
Custom-built Unity UI
Cross-platform compatibility
Replay-focused design

projects.title: Blackjack
projects.blurb: A C++ implementation of the classic casino card game, built from scratch using SDL2 with a modular, state-driven architecture.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Blackjack is a digital recreation of the classic casino card game, developed for Windows using C++ and the SDL2 library suite. Built as an exploration of state machines and object-oriented design patterns, the project demonstrates clean architecture and responsive UI interaction.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Hierarchical State Machine: Manages transitions between menus, gameplay, and pause states with clean modular control.
Rule-Based Dealer Logic: Implements traditional Blackjack decision-making to handle dealer behavior and outcomes.
Timer-Based Animation: Card dealing and visual pacing are controlled with timed delays for a more authentic feel.
Interactive UI: Mouse-driven input and on-screen buttons for intuitive play, including in-game help menus.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Developed entirely in C++ with SDL2 and its extensions for rendering, audio, and input management.
Implements the State and Strategy design patterns for clean code separation and scalability.
Lightweight game loop with efficient resource management for smooth performance.
Cross-platform-ready architecture for easy adaptation beyond Windows builds.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Classic Blackjack gameplay
State-driven architecture
Rule-based dealer AI
Timed card animations
Mouse-based controls
In-game help and menu system
Lightweight SDL2 framework
Cross-platform potential

projects.title: Battle for Earth
projects.blurb: A 2D platformer built in C++ with Allegro4, featuring custom physics, enemy AI, and modular text-driven level design.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Battle for Earth is a 2D platformer developed in C++ using the Allegro4 library. Designed for Windows, the project demonstrates custom physics, modular content design, and a lightweight game engine structure built entirely from scratch. Players navigate side-scrolling levels, engage unique enemies, and follow a short text-based narrative.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Custom Physics Engine: Hand-built platforming system for movement, jumping, and collision simulation.
State Management System: Menu and gameplay states handled via a flexible, modular state controller.
Level Definition via Text Files: Levels and block configurations are read from text files for fast iteration and easy expansion.
Dual Input Support: Fully playable using either mouse or keyboard controls for accessibility.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Allegro4-based Rendering: Low-level graphics and input handling implemented using C++ and Allegro APIs.
Text-Driven Game Data: Environments and entities defined through editable text files to streamline content creation.
Custom Entity System: Enemies and blocks use script-like configurations for behavior and animation.
Modular Design: Architecture supports seamless addition of new levels, assets, and enemy types.

sections.title: Key Features
items: 2D platformer gameplay
Custom-built physics engine
Editable level data via text files
Unique enemy AI behaviors
Mouse and keyboard control options
State-driven menus and game flow
Text-based storytelling elements
Optimized Allegro4 framework

projects.title: Space Fighter
projects.blurb: A modern remake of the classic Asteroids arcade game, built in C++ using Allegro5 with dynamic scaling, power-ups, and parallax effects.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Space Fighter is a modern take on the classic Asteroids arcade game, developed in C++ using the Allegro5 framework. Designed for Windows, the project demonstrates advanced state management, parallax scrolling backgrounds, and progressive gameplay scaling with randomized power-ups and enemy encounters.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: State Machine Architecture: Separates menu, gameplay, and pause states with modular transitions.
Dynamic Difficulty Scaling: Enemy spawn rates and level intensity increase over time for sustained challenge.
Power-Up System: Randomly spawned buffs provide temporary advantages or weapon upgrades.
Parallax Backgrounds: Multi-layered scrolling environment enhances visual depth during gameplay and menus.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Developed in C++ using Allegro5 for graphics, input, and timing systems.
Real-time spawning system controlling enemy waves and collectible items.
Point-based scoring logic tied to difficulty progression and level scaling.
Unified rendering pipeline shared between gameplay and UI scenes.

projects.title: Lab Sim
projects.blurb: A 3D interactive laboratory simulator built in Unity and C#, developed for educational training in realistic scientific environments.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Lab Sim is an advanced 3D virtual laboratory developed in C# using the Unity engine. Designed in collaboration with academic professionals, it allows students in scientific disciplines to conduct experiments in a realistic and interactive virtual environment. The project aims to supplement traditional learning by replicating laboratory procedures with high fidelity and accuracy.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Physics-Based Interactions: Simulated fluid and solid dynamics for realistic material behavior.
Chemical Reactions: Visual and logical systems for color change, mixing, and combination of chemicals.
Scientific Instrumentation: Interactive tools such as microscopes, scales, and containers emulate real-world laboratory procedures.
Time Simulation System: Adjustable time flow to replicate long-term experiments or timed challenges.
Modular Protocol Framework: Supports multiple experiments and gameplay modes for diverse learning objectives.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Developed in Unity with C#, utilizing particle systems, shaders, and real-time physics for realistic lab simulations.
Configurable modular architecture enabling quick integration of new experiments and apparatus.
Scenario-based design allows instructors or clients to define specific experiment protocols and conditions.
Custom UI and input systems built for intuitive interaction and training efficiency.

sections.title: Example Scenarios
items: Selecting, pouring, and combining chemicals with realistic fluid dynamics.
Weighing and mixing powdered compounds to form solutions.
Examining and analyzing slides under a virtual microscope.
Humidifying and storing samples overnight in controlled conditions.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Accurate scientific simulation
Fluid and solid dynamics
Multiple experiment modes
Time simulation system
Modular, extensible design
Academic collaboration
High-fidelity visual feedback
Cross-compatible interactive tools

projects.title: Saving Security
projects.blurb: A branching-narrative 3D simulation where player choices dynamically affect storylines, factions, and world outcomes.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Saving Security is a 3D narrative-driven simulation game developed in Unity and C#. The experience centers on player-driven decision-making, where every choice influences the evolving storyline, faction relationships, and ultimate outcome. Built with a modular design, the system allows for new storylines, characters, and events to be easily added or adapted.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Modular Story Framework: Narrative events, choices, and outcomes are data-driven for flexibility and scalability.
Choice & Consequence Engine: Player decisions dynamically alter story branches, unlock locations, and shape faction relations.
Faction Reputation System: Multiple in-game factions track player reputation, affecting dialogue, events, and story accessibility.
Dynamic Unlocking System: As the player progresses, new areas and interactions become available based on prior actions.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Unity and C# implementation using ScriptableObjects for event and choice management.
Custom dialogue and branching narrative system with data-driven conditions.
Adaptive scene transitions that preserve state and faction data across story modules.
Flexible story editor architecture enabling easy expansion and reconfiguration of plotlines.

sections.title: Gameplay Experience
items: Make impactful choices that shape the narrative direction and world state.
Influence multiple factions whose attitudes evolve based on player behavior.
Unlock new locations and events as the story progresses.
View a detailed summary at the end of each playthrough that reflects moral alignment, decisions, and faction standings.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Branching narrative structure
Reactive faction systems
Dynamic world progression
High replayability
Player-driven moral outcomes
Modular event framework

AI Opponent Framework: Multiple difficulty levels with unique decision-making profiles.
Dynamic Scoring System: Calculates win conditions based on cumulative card totals.
Customizable Deck Management: Supports variable card set sizes for flexible gameplay.

AI behavior trees and probability-based decision systems for opponent strategy.
Data-driven configuration enabling new AI profiles and deck layouts without code changes.
Integrated statistics tracking to record player performance and outcomes.

projects.title: Rescue Squad
projects.blurb: A Unity-based mission simulator testing player decision-making and risk management through adaptive scenarios.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Rescue Squad is a mission-based simulation game built in Unity using C#. Designed to assess player decision-making and aversion to risk, it challenges players to manage a team of adventurers and make strategic choices under uncertain conditions. The system dynamically adapts to player behavior, offering a mix of analysis and entertainment.

items: Squad Management: Players assemble and command a team of unique adventurers, each with specialized traits and skill levels.
Mission Generation: Procedurally generates missions with varying objectives, difficulty levels, and required attributes.
Outcome Simulation: Calculates mission results based on team composition and success probability, presented through animated sequences.
Reputation Tracking: Adjusts the player’s reputation and standing based on mission performance and risk-taking behavior.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Unity C# framework with modular mission and AI behavior systems.
Data-driven character attributes and procedural mission generation.
Dynamic difficulty scaling based on player risk profile and past decisions.
Custom animation system to visualize success and failure outcomes.

Performance Evaluation: End-of-round summary comparing player outcomes to target benchmarks.

projects.title: Game Theory
projects.blurb: An interactive WebGL simulation that teaches foundational concepts of game theory using adjustable decision-based scenarios.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Game Theory is an interactive WebGL learning tool developed in Unity using C#. It was designed to teach the foundational concepts of game theory — such as cooperation, competition, and payoff optimization — through a simulation of the classic Prisoner’s Dilemma scenario.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Interactive Simulation: Allows users to adjust input variables representing the likelihood of various player decisions.
Dynamic Outcome Calculation: Uses core game theory equations to compute optimal results and payoff outcomes.
Educational Visualization: Displays real-time feedback on decision outcomes to reinforce key theoretical concepts.
Scenario Framework: Supports extension beyond the Prisoner’s Dilemma to other strategic interaction models.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Unity WebGL build optimized for browser-based interactivity and accessibility.
C# calculation engine applying payoff matrices and probability distributions.
Clean modular UI for adjusting parameters and visualizing decision outcomes.
Scalable design for adding new models or game theory simulations in future iterations.

sections.title: Gameplay Experience
items: Adjust input sliders or fields to modify player decision probabilities.
Observe how strategy and cooperation affect payoff outcomes.
Experiment with multiple iterations to explore long-term equilibrium behavior.
Learn through direct interaction with fundamental game theory concepts.

projects.title: Marketing Sim
projects.blurb: A browser-based marketing strategy simulator that teaches campaign budgeting and outcome analysis through interactive scenarios.

sections.content: Marketing Sim is a browser-based marketing strategy simulator built with Unity and C#. It teaches players how to allocate budgets, plan campaigns, and assess marketing outcomes. Designed for educational integration, it runs as a WebGL application embedded within a webpage and supports easy post-launch customization through modular data structures.

sections.title: Core Systems
items: Budget Allocation System: Players assign limited resources across various marketing channels to maximize effectiveness.
Campaign Configuration: Editors can define new businesses, budgets, and available options through modular data files.
Outcome Simulation: The system evaluates campaign success based on player decisions, business type, and resource distribution.
Custom Content Framework: Facilitates the creation of new campaign types and scenarios without code modification.

sections.title: Technical Highlights
items: Built using Unity’s WebGL exporter for seamless browser deployment.
Data-driven design using JSON configuration files for campaigns and parameters.
Modular C# architecture supporting rapid customization and content iteration.
Optimized UI for clear feedback on spending efficiency and marketing outcomes.

Distribute resources across multiple advertising options and channels.
